home.about-me: Hello and thanks for for being here, i hope you enjoy it. I am a front end web developer, curious and passionate about new technologies. My developer background started by studying on my own and then attending ITS Steve Jobs Academy school. In this school I learned many front end and back end programming languages. I worked with various frameworks and libraries such as Angular 2, Ionic, React and React Native using JavaScript and TypeScript and I must admit that among all I prefer React.
home.education-steve-jobs: ITS Steve Jobs Academy offers highly specialized courses recognized by MIUR, with practical lessons and 720 hours of internship, teaching languages and frameworks most used in both front end and back end development, thanks to lessons specially designed by university professors and professional programmers.
home.education-school: Graduated in Electronics, Electrotechnics and Telecommunications, i have specific skills in the field of materials and construction technologies of electrical and electronic systems and electrical machines, generation, processing and transmission of electrical and electronic signals, networks of processing systems, multimedia systems, transmission and reception equipment of telecommunications networks and systems.
home.experience-1: Develop and maintain responsive web app using SCSS, Typescript, React, Redux, Apollo GraphQL. Develop and maintain hybrid app using Ionic, Typescript, React, Redux, Apollo GraphQL. Work closely with UI/UX and Graphic Designers to translate designs into pixel-perfect web apps. Engaged in the Agile process by attending weekly planning meetings and writing user stories. Follow standard practices for version control through Git.
home.experience-2: Migration and developed of an important web app banking from Angular.js to Angular 10. Follow standard practices for version control through Git.
home.experience-3: Developed a website using Angular 2, with SSR and internationalization with i18n. Maintained many projects, especially  a CMS of famous e-commerce at European level, developed in React, store in Redux and back end in Firebase. Maintained and refactoring of an european banking app developed in React Native. Follow standard practices for version control through Git.

errors.apiKeyDisabled: Your API key has been disabled.
errors.apiKeyExhausted: Your API key has no more requests available.
errors.apiKeyInvalid: Your API key hasn't been entered correctly. Double check it and try again.
errors.apiKeyMissing: Your API key is missing from the request. Append it to the request with one of these methods.
errors.parameterInvalid: You've included a parameter in your request which is currently not supported. Check the message property for more details.
errors.parametersMissing: Required parameters are missing from the request and it cannot be completed. Check the message property for more details.
errors.rateLimited: You have been rate limited. Back off for a while before trying the request again.
errors.sourcesTooMany: You have requested too many sources in a single request. Try splitting the request into 2 smaller requests.
errors.sourceDoesNotExist: You have requested a source which does not exist.
errors.unexpectedError: This shouldn't happen, and if it does then it's our fault, not yours. Try the request again shortly.
